Pre-Game Insights: England will face Greece in a highly anticipated Nations League encounter at Wembley this Thursday, marking their first meeting in 18 years.
Historically, England have dominated Greece, remaining undefeated in nine previous encounters, winning seven and drawing two.
For interim manager Lee Carsley, it’s another opportunity to prove his credentials as he leads the Three Lions in this Group B2 clash.
Team News and Predicted Line-ups: Captain Harry Kane is set to lead the line after overcoming an injury scare while on duty with Bayern Munich.
Greece, meanwhile, have a full-strength squad, with West Ham’s Dinos Mavropanos and Liverpool’s Kostas Tsimikas likely to start.
Venue, Date, and How to Watch England vs: The game will be broadcast live in the UK on ITV1, with live streaming available via the ITVX app.
Others: This article does not provide any new records, key match events, post-match reflections, miscellaneous highlights, or other details beyond the pre-game insights, team news, and viewing details.
